FindingName: Storage Accounts Minimum TLS Version Less Than TLSv1.2
Description: Cross Tenant Replication is configured for the identified storage accounts. This is a default configuration is a security concern as the tenant's data can be replicated to a storage account in a foreign tenant.
Remediation:
Disable Cross Tenant Replication for storage accounts, unless it is a business requirement. If this feature is required, monitor access requests using Azure Metrics Explorer.
To remediate for existing Storage Accounts:
Go to "Storage Accounts" > select the affected storage account, select "Object replication" under "Data Management" > select the "Advanced settings" and uncheck the "Allow cross-tenant replication" box, select OK to save this configuration.
Alternatively, the following PowerShell commands can be run on each of the affected blobs:
Set-AzStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "$ResourceGroupName" -Name "$StorageAccountName" -AllowCrossTenantReplication $false

To configure a new Storage Account to disallow Cross Tenant Replication navigate to the "Advanced" tab during account creation. Under the "Blob storage" section, uncheck the "Allow cross-tenant replication" box.

References.Text: Enforce a minimum required version of Transport Layer Security (TLS) for requests to a storage account
